title: in_string can be very slow
body:
## Bug Report

In my PC, perform `IN(90 strings)` for 1000 records takes 0.2s without index.

Ideas:

- When there are many strings to compare (i.e. in_string for a lot of parameters), we can use Trie.
- Sort the candidate array and use binary search

Edge cases:
- NULL
- maybe there is no > or < operator over some data type
- maybe a > b and b > c doesn't mean a > c
- etc
We can first improve cache locality for strings.
